DataElement.preferredName: QC Slide Review Tumor Segment Identifier Integer
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A number used to identify the tumor segment collected as part of the quality control review of the tumor biospecimen for proteomic and genomic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: QC Slide Review Tumor Segment Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Tissue Source Sites (TSS) will perform a QC review of tumor biospecimens by review of slides from corresponding FFPE QC blocks. For each tumor segment, an H&E-stained slide is to be prepared and reviewed by the TSS pathologist to confirm accuracy of tissue diagnosis and tumor composition._Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tissue Source Sites (TSS) will perform a QC review of tumor biospecimens by review of slides from corresponding FFPE QC blocks. For each tumor segment, an H&E-stained slide is to be prepared and reviewed by the TSS pathologist to confirm accuracy of tissue diagnosis and tumor composition.

Concepts.definition: Tissue Source Sites (TSS) will perform a QC review of tumor biospecimens by review of slides from corresponding FFPE QC blocks. For each tumor segment, an H&E-stained slide is to be prepared and reviewed by the TSS pathologist to confirm accuracy of tissue diagnosis and tumor composition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A positive number with no fractional part between 0 and 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set.  8/7/19 jk created for CPTAC baseline CRFs.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/17/21 jk added CM Path Rpt CSI. 7/12/21 jk added HNSCC Path Rpt CSI.  4/30/20 jk added CPTAC LGG Path CSI.  4/17/20 jk def mods per SME review to support Slide Creation CRF.  1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/7/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.
